oracle.mapviewer.share.stylex
Class CollectionStyleModel

java.lang.Object
  oracle.mapviewer.share.style.AbstractStyleModel
      oracle.mapviewer.share.stylex.CollectionStyleModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, StyleModel
public class CollectionStyleModel
extends AbstractStyleModel

Model class for MapViewer collection style. Collection style model defines a set of styles that can be used to render features. It can be defined in two different ways.

1) Allows to render geometry collections with styles for each different shape. 

   <CollectionStyle>
     <style name="C.RED" shape="polygon" />
     <style name="L.PH" shape="line" />
     <style name="M.STAR" shape="point" />
   </CollectionStyle>

This can be applied for topology collections, and also for geometries of type collection.

2) Allows to define more than one style for a theme. In this case the shape attribute is not defined, and the styles are used for all features. For example, rendering the polygons of a layer with a color, and also a pie chart style. 

    <CollectionStyle>
      <style name="C.RED" />
      <style name="V.PIECHART_STYLE"/>
    </CollectionStyle>

See Also:

addStyle

public boolean addStyle(java.lang.String name,
                        oracle.sdovis.style.Style style,
                        java.lang.String shapeType)
Adds a new style to the style collection. If the shape type is null, then this style will be used to render any shape.

Parameters:
name - style name
style - style element (if null then default red color is assigned)
shapeType - geometry type (point, line or polygon)
Returns:
boolean - true if name and style have not been added
